As you gain artificer levels, the psychic damage increases: at 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), at 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and at 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

subclassFeature.name: Acute Overload
entries: {@i 5th-level Archivist feature}

The power of your Artificial Mind has increased. Whenever a creature fails its save against Information Overload you can expend an artificer spell slot to increase the psychic damage. The damage increases by {@damage 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional {@damage 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, when you deal psychic damage using your Artificial Mind as a spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Improved Consciousness
entries: {@i 9th-level Archivist feature}

When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell while you are attuned to your Artificial Mind, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
Moreover, your Artificial Mind doesn't count against the total number of magical objects you can be attuned to.
Finally, you can use Information Overload as a bonus action on your turns. However, you can only use Information Overload once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Master Archivist
entries: {@i 15th-level Archivist feature}

You have become a master of Archivist artifice. As an action on your turn, you can transform into pure information and teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 60 feet, or an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a creature or object bearing one of your artificer Infusions.

subclassFeature.name: Chronothief
entries: For those that pursue the magic of artifice, no area of study is too dangerous. Perhaps against their better judgment, some artificers choose to experiment with Chronomancy, the magic of time. Known as Chronothieves, these bold artificers are marked by their signature Chronometers, a wondrous object that they use to steal moments and adjust the flow of time.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: {@i 1st-level Chronothief feature}
You gain proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with jeweler's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.
In addition, you are always aware of the exact time while you are on your home plane of existence. Once you spend a full day on another plane you gain this benefit there as well.

entries.name: Chronothieves & Dunamancy Magic
entries: If your table uses the Dunamancy magic found in Explorer's Guide to Wildemount, your Chronothief is considered familiar with such secret magic.
Moreover, when you gain the Chronothief Spells feature at 2nd level, you can choose to replace the spells you would normally gain from that feature with any Dunamancy spell of the same spell level.

subclassFeature.name: Chronometer
entries: {@i 1st-level Chronothief feature}

You have learned to construct a wondrous device that marks you as a Chronothief. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use your jeweler's tools to construct a Chronometer, which appears as a Tiny object of your choice. Chronometers often resemble tiny hourglasses filled with sand, intricate contraptions, or pocket watches.
When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, your Chronometer can be used as a spellcasting focus by you.
You can only have one Chronometer at a time, and creating a second causes the magic of the first to instantly dispel. The new Chronometer has the same number of charges as the previous Chronometer.

Your Chronometer has a number of Charges equal to twice your Intelligence modifier and regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. While holding your Chronometer, you can expend 1 Charge to use one of the abilities below:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: As a bonus action, you can increase the speed of a creature you can see within 60 feet by a total number of feet equal to 5 times your Proficiency Bonus until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: As a bonus action, you can force a creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, its speed is reduced by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Proficiency Bonus until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Chronothief Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Chronothief feature}
You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Chronometer
entries: {@i 3rd-level Chronothief feature}
You have come to a deeper understanding of chronomancy magic, growing your Chronometer's power. You can expend 1 Charge of your Chronometer to use the following abilities:

entries.name: Rush
entries: When you roll initiative and aren't surprised, you can replace the d20 for your initiative roll with your artificer level.

entries.name: Slip
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force them to re-roll as a reaction. You can use this reaction after the creature rolls.

entries.name: Warp
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch places with a creature you can see within 60 feet, each instantly teleporting to the other's space. Unwilling creatures must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be forced to switch places.

subclassFeature.name: Stolen Moments
entries: {@i 5th-level Chronothief feature}

Your Chronometer can capture time for later use. When you successfully paralyze, stun, or reduce a hostile creature's speed with an artificer spell of 1st level or higher or one of your Chronothief abilities, your Chronometer regains {@dice 1d4} of its expended charges.
Also, you can use a bonus action to expend an artificer spell slot and cause your Chronometer to regain expended charges equal to the level of the spell slot you expend.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Chronomancy
entries: {@i 9th-level Chronothief feature}
Your understanding and control over time magic has greatly increased. Your Chronometer improves in the following ways:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: Opportunity attacks against the target creature have disadvantage until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: You can spend an additional Charge to double the speed reduction. If this feature reduces a target's speed to 0, the creature is put under the effects of the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Rush
entries: You also gain a bonus to your initiative roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Master Chronothief
entries: {@i 15th-level Chronothief feature}
You have become a master Chronothief. While holding your Chronometer, you can use your action to overload the device, expending all of its remaining Charges, to cast {@spell time stop}.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast time stop in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced
entries: Where most artificers develop objects of wondrous power, those known as Enhanced bring their great intellect to bear by modifying their own bodies. They replace and improve their own limbs with arcane enhancements, forever striving to create a more perfect self. Enhanced artificers are known for their impressive, and deadly, combat Enhancements.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: {@i 1st-level Enhanced feature}

You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with smith's or woodcarver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Enhancement
entries: {@i 1st-level Enhanced feature}
You modify one of your arms to bear a hidden blade. It is a simple melee weapon with the finesse property that deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on hit and has the following abilities:

items: It is completely concealed within your arm unless you use a bonus action to activate or retract your blade.
It can bear one Infusion meant for a melee weapon.
You can use your Intelligence, in place of your Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls of your blade.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Enhanced feature}
You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Enhancements
entries: {@i 3rd-level Enhanced feature}
You gain one Enhancement of your choice from the list below. They can be attached in place of a missing body part, or over a body part.
When you gain an artificer level you can switch replace your Enhancement with another Enhancement of your choice.
As you gain artificer levels, your body can bear additional Enhancements at one time: at 5th level (2), 9th level (3), and at 15th level (4).

entries.name: Mobility Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your legs. You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Nimble Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your hands. You add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any Dexterity checks you make that involve your modified hand.

entries.name: Power Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your arms. You can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any Strength checks you make that involve your modified arm.

entries.name: Visual Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your eyes. You can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any checks you make that rely on your sense of sight.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Enhancement
entries: {@i 5th-level Enhanced feature}
You have improved your modifications to further augment your combat abilities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.
Each of your Enhancements can bear a single Infusion usually meant for the following objects: Mobility (boots), Nimble (gauntlets), Power (armor), Visual (helm, goggles).
Your Blade counts as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Enhancements
entries: {@i 9th-level Enhanced feature}
Your number of Infusions Known increases by 1, but this additional Infusion must be applied to an Enhancement.
The damage of your blade attacks also becomes {@damage 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Enhanced
entries: {@i 15th-level Enhanced feature}

Choose one of your Enhancements to become a Masterwork Enhancement, granting you the additional benefits below. Each time you finish a long rest, you can replace your Masterwork Enhancement with another of your choice.

entries.name: Blade Masterwork
entries: Your Blade Enhancement weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

entries.name: Mobile Masterwork
entries: When you take the {@action Dash} action you are immune to opportunity attacks and you can move along vertical surfaces and liquids without falling during the move.

entries.name: Nimble Masterwork
entries: When you make a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Power Masterwork
entries: When you make a Strength check with your modified arm, you treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

entries.name: Visual Masterwork
entries: When you make a check that relies on your sense of sight, you treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Machinist
entries: While some artificers spend their lives perfecting one solitary creation, Machinist artificer value quantity over quality. They are known for creating their signature Automatons, small clockwork men that are created for a single, but temporary purpose. Armed with their tools, and an army of strange and wondrous servants, Machinists are ready for any challenge.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: {@i 1st-level Machinist feature}
You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Automatons
entries: {@i 1st-level Machinist feature}

You learned to craft unique mechanical servants known as Automatons. At the end of each long rest, you can use your smith's tools to craft a Small Automaton in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. This Automaton has the abilities of the Agent model detailed further on.

Automatons are magical constructs with an Armor Class equal to 12 + your Intelligence modifier and hit points equal to your artificer level + your Intelligence modifier. When they make an ability check or a saving throw, its ability scores are 10 (+0). If {@spell mending} is cast on one, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour.

In order to create an additional Automaton before the end of your next long rest, you must expend an artificer spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create one. You can only have a single operational Automaton at any one time. Creating a second Automaton causes any previous ones to instantly fall apart.

Your Automatons can do nothing on their own. However, you can use a bonus action on your turn to activate one of your Automatons so long as you are within 60 feet of it. As part of this bonus action, you can also cause your Automation to move up to 25 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Machinist Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Machinist feature}
You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Innovative Models
entries: {@i 3rd-level Machinist feature}
You have improved your craft. Whenever you create an Automaton, choose one of the Automaton models below:

entries.name: Agent Automaton
entries: When activated, you see and hear through the Automaton, so long as you are within 100 feet of it. You are deaf and blind to your senses until you end this link as a bonus action.

entries.name: Anchor Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton latches onto a target within 5 feet, reducing the target's speed by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet).

entries.name: Armor Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 feet. While attached, that creature's Armor Class cannot be less than 13 + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Artisan Automaton
entries: This Automaton is proficient with one set of tools, and when activated, it makes an ability check with its tool set, and adds your intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to its roll.

entries.name: Assault Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton makes a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: {@i 5th-level Machinist feature}

You can channel your signature artificer magic through your Automatons. When you cast an artificer spell, you can choose for the spell to originate from an Automaton of your choice, instead of yourself, so long as you are within 60 feet of it.

subclassFeature.name: Automated Army
entries: {@i 5th-level Machinist feature}
You now create two Automatons of your choice at the end of each long rest without expending a spell slot, and you can activate up to two Automatons with the same bonus action.
At 15th level, you can create and control up to three.

subclassFeature.name: Efficient Artifice
entries: {@i 9th-level Machinist feature}

Whenever you expend an artificer spell slot to create an Automaton, you create a number of Automatons equal to the level of the spell slot expended. You cannot use this feature to exceed the maximum number of Automatons you can control.

subclassFeature.name: Master Machinist
entries: {@i 15th-level Machinist feature}

You have become a master of Machinist artifice. When you are forced to make a saving throw or are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to switch places with one of your Automatons within 60 feet. The Automaton then becomes the target of the attack or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer
entries: Though all artificers have their quirks, Puppeteers tend to be the strangest subset of arcane inventors. They dedicate their research and intellect towards mastery of manipulation and control of other creatures through the use of their Marionette Strings. Often found literally pulling the strings from behind the scenes, these strange artificers prefer to empower their allies rather than risk their own lives on the front lines.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: {@i 1st-level Puppeteer feature}
You gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with weaver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Threads
entries: {@i 1st-level Puppeteer feature}

You have constructed for yourself arcane threads that you can manipulate with magic. You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip, and when you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, it doesn't count against your total number of Cantrips Known. When you cast thorn whip it has the following changes:

items: You must use weaver's tools as the spellcasting focus.
You can choose for the spell not to damage a creature.

You can target objects and creatures. If the object is smaller than you and is not being worn or carried, it is pulled up to 30 feet to you. If the object is larger than you, you can pull yourself up to 30 feet toward the object.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Puppeteer feature}
You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Marionette Strings
entries: {@i 3rd-level Puppeteer feature}
You can use your strange artifice to help and control. While holding weaver's tools, you can use an action to cause your Strings to fly and attach to a willing creature within 30 feet.

While a creature is attached to your Strings, you gain the features listed below. Your Marionette Strings detach after 1 minute, if you use a bonus action to detach them, or if you and the attached creature are ever more than 30 feet apart.

entries.name: Corrected Strike
entries: When the attached creature makes a melee attack, you can use your reaction to have them re-roll their attack roll, and they must use the new roll.

entries.name: Channel Spell.
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cast an artificer spell as if it originated from the attached creature. If the spell requires concentration, you must concentrate on it.

entries.name: Strands of Guidance
entries: When the attached creature makes an ability check using a skill that you are proficient in, they add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to their roll.

entries.name: Strange Movement
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the attached creature a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet). This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Strikes
entries: {@i 5th-level Puppeteer feature}
The control you can exert through your Strings grows. As a reaction when the creature attached to your Strings makes an attack, you can cause them to make one additional attack.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Fingers
entries: {@i 9th-level Puppeteer feature}

You can have up to two creatures attached to your Strings at one time. You must have a free hand to control each creature. The two creatures can be any distance apart from each other, so long as they remain within the range of your Strings.
In addition, the length of your Marionette Strings, and the range of all of your Puppeteer abilities increases to 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Master Puppeteer
entries: {@i 15th-level Puppeteer feature}

You have become a master Puppeteer. As an action, you can use your weaver's tools to cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance}, without expending a spell slot, or requiring concentration. However, you can only have once instance of this spell active at a time, and the spell requires one of your free hands to maintain.
Once you cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance} this way, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Arm Launcher
entries: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, a vial of acid, or holy water. As a bonus action, the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged weapon attack at a target up to 20 feet away. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Arcane Focus
entries: This item grants the user +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, and they can ignore half cover when making spell attacks.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

item: A rod, staff or wand (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Defense
entries: This item grants the user +1 bonus to their armor class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) this infused item.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

item: A suit of armor or a shield

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants the user a +1 bonus to any attack and damage rolls they make with this infused weapon.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Belt
entries: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities. You also ignore the Strength requirements for any armor while wearing this infusion.
At 11th level, it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

item: A belt or a cloak (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Weapon
entries: This magic weapon loses the heavy property if it had it. If it did not have the heavy property, it gains the light property.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Goggles of Clearsight
entries: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through areas that are lightly obscured by magical or mundane phenomena without disadvantage on Perception checks.
In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects of the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, and they have advantage on saving throws to resist becoming blinded.

item: A pair of goggles or glasses

optionalfeature.name: Power Whip
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and its damage die becomes a {@dice 1d8}.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot
entries: This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack. The ammunition vanishes after it either hits or misses.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Salve
entries: You can apply this magical salve to heal the wounds of you or your companions. The healing salve has 4 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge and touch a creature, healing that creature a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier. The salve regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon
entries: After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, regardless if the attack hits or misses its target, it instantaneously returns to its wielder's hand.
At 11th level this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A weapon with the thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Homing Weapon
entries: The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon's long range.
At 11th level it gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus becomes +2 at 17th level.

item: A weapon with the ranged or thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Boots
entries: When the wearer is standing on a flat surface, it can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the wearer in place. Until the wearer uses an action to deactivate the boots, they do not move, even if they are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating the boots from the surface on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Infiltrator Armor
entries: This magic suit of armor retains its weight but is formfitting and wearable under clothes. The wearer of this armor has advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
If this armor normally imposes disadvantage on Stealth checks, the advantage and disadvantage cancel each other.

optionalfeature.name: Light Blade
entries: While grasping the object, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or disappear, from the end of this object. While the blade exists, this magic item is considered a simple melee weapon with the finesse property, and it deals {@damage 1d8} radiant damage on hit.
The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet beyond that radius.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Mind Sharpener
entries: This item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, they can use their reaction to spend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains all expended charges at dawn.

item: A suit of armor or robes

optionalfeature.name: Minor Arcane Item
entries: You imbue this object with a minor amount of arcane power. Each time you imbue this Infusion into an object, you choose a 1st-level artificer spell you know to imbue. A creature that holds the item can cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time and your spellcasting ability.
If the spell requires concentration, that creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.
This item holds a number of charges of the imbued spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item: a Tiny item or tool (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action.

This magical weapon has 4 charges. When its wielder hits a creature with this weapon, it can expend 1 charge and force its target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition blinded} until the beginning of your next turn. This weapon regains all expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Gauntlets
entries: These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When their wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike or gauntlet attack, it can expend 1 charge and force a Large or smaller target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line. These gauntlets regain all of their expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Shield
entries: This magic shield has 4 charges. When the wielder is hit by a melee attack, they can force a Large or smaller attacker to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line and falls {@condition prone}. The shield regains all of its expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level this magic shield grants a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This Armor Class bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Magical Strength
entries: This magical armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class, and its wearer can also use its Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength-based ability checks or saving throws.

This armor also has 4 charges. As a reaction when the wearer would be knocked {@condition prone} or moved against their will, they can expend 1 charge to remain standing or not move. The armor regains all of its expended charges at dawn.
At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

optionalfeature.name: Boots of the Winding Path
entries: The wearer of these magical boots can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon Armor
entries: This armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class.

This armor also has 4 charges. While wearing this armor the wearer can use an action to expend charges and cast one of the following spells, targeting only themselves: {@spell invisibility} (2 charges) or {@spell greater invisibility} (4 charges). This magical armor regains all of its expended charges daily at dawn.
At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Weapon
entries: You infuse this magic weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion, choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the weapon's command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} of the chosen elemental damage.
At 17th level, the bonus elemental damage becomes {@damage 2d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Arcane Item
entries: You imbue this object with a greater amount of arcane power. Each time you imbue this Infusion into an object, you choose a 2nd-level artificer spell you know to imbue. A creature that holds the item can cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time and your spellcasting ability.
If the spell requires concentration, that creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.
This item holds a number of charges of the imbued spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item: a Tiny item or tool (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Awareness
entries: The wearer of this helm gains a bonus to its initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1), and cannot be surprised, so long as they are not {@condition incapacitated}.

item: A helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Resistant Armor
entries: This magical armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class, and its wearer has resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder (your choice upon Infusion).
At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class, and you can choose for this magical armor to grant its wearer resistance to psychic or force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ring of the Elements
entries: Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder.
When the wearer casts a spell of 3rd-level or lower that deals that damage type, it can activate the ring to cause its spell to deal maximum damage to one target of that spell.
Once the wearer uses this ring to maximize the damage of a spell it cannot be used again until the next dawn.
At 17th level, it can be used on spells of 5th-level or lower.

optionalfeature.name: Gauntlets of the Guardian
entries: These magic gauntlets are infused with wondrous arcane power. As a reaction when a Huge or smaller creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wearer, it can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled 30 feet toward the wielder to an unoccupied space of its choice. If they pull the creature within 5 feet, the wielder can make a single melee weapon attack against it.

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Mind Shielding
entries: The wearer of this magic helm gains resistance to psychic damage and immunity to both the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions and magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

item: A helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Masterwork Arcane Item
entries: You imbue this object with wondrous arcane power. Each time you imbue this Infusion into an object, you choose a 3rd-level artificer spell you know to imbue. A creature that holds the item can cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time and your spellcasting ability.
If the spell requires concentration, that creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.
This item holds a number of charges of the imbued spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item: a Tiny item or tool (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Masterwork Homunculus
entries: You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the {@spell clone} spell. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known. You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available. Your clone only takes 12 days to reach maturity, but you can only have one.
If you replace this Infusion with another at any point before your clone reaches maturity, the spell immediately fails.

optionalfeature.name: Close Shot
entries: When you make a ranged attack against a creature within 5 feet of you with your Firearm, you do not have disadvantage on your attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Shot
entries: You can infuse your Arcane Firearm with elemental power. As a bonus action, you can touch your Arcane Firearm and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher and choose either acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison. For the next minute, your Arcane Firearm deals additional damage of that type on hit.
The elemental damage is {@damage 1d4} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus an additional {@damage 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1st.

optionalfeature.name: Grooved Barrel
entries: You modify your Arcane Firearm to be especially accurate. You ignore the disadvantage imposed on Arcane Firearm attacks that you make at the weapon's long range.

optionalfeature.name: High Caliber
entries: Your Arcane Firearm packs a punch. It deals {@damage 1d12} piercing damage on hit, but it also gains the heavy property.

optionalfeature.name: Increased Capacity
entries: Your Arcane Firearm holds additional ammo. You can ignore the loading property for your Arcane Firearm.

optionalfeature.name: Infused Firearm
entries: Your Arcane Firearm can bear an additional one of your Infusions, so long as it meets the Infusion's prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Rounds
entries: Once per turn when you hit a target with an Arcane Firearm attack, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Artificer Spell save DC. On a failure, the target is {@condition blinded} until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Concussive Rounds
entries: Once per turn when you hit a target with an Arcane Firearm attack, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Artificer Spell save DC. On a failure, the target cannot take reactions and its movement speed is halved until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Rounds
entries: Once per turn when you hit a target with an Arcane Firearm attack, you can force creatures within 5 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Artificer Spell save DC. On a failure, the creatures take damage as if they had been hit by your Arcane Firearm attack themselves.

optionalfeature.name: Incapacitating Rounds
entries: Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller target with an Arcane Firearm attack, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw against your Artificer Spell save DC. On a failure, it is {@condition restrained} until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Railgun
entries: Once per turn when you make an attack with your Arcane Firearm, you can instead force creatures in a 60-foot line to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Artificer Spell save DC. On a failed save, creatures take damage as if they had been hit by an attack with your Arcane Firearm.

optionalfeature.name: Independent Turret
entries: As an action, you can set your Arcane Firearm up as a turret in an unoccupied 5-foot space. While you are within 120 feet of your Arcane Firearm, you can use a bonus action to cause your Arcane Firearm to make an attack, or use one of its other abilities, targeting a creature you can see within its range.

optionalfeature.name: Adjustable Tool Set
entries: The wielder is considered proficient with this magical set of tools, and as an action, they can transform this set of tools into another set of artisan's tools of their choice.
At 11th level, this magical tool set grants a +1 bonus to ability checks. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: a set of artisan's tools (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Instrument
entries: The wielder is proficient with this magic instrument and can use it as a spellcasting focus. Whenever they make an ability check using this instrument, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
At 11th level, this magic instrument grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Tool Set
entries: Whenever the wielder uses these tools as part of an ability check, it gains a bonus to that ability check equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

item: a set of tools you are proficient with

optionalfeature.name: Ring of Proficiency
entries: The wearer of this ring gains proficiency in one skill or set of tools that you are proficient in (your choice upon infusion).

optionalfeature.name: Many-Handed Pouch
entries: These magic pouches all share one interdimensional space with the capacity of a single pouch. Reaching into an infused pouch allows access to this shared storage space. A pouch operates as long as it is within 100 miles of another pouch; the pouch is otherwise empty and won't accept contents.
If the Infusion ends, the items stored in the shared space all move into one of the pouches, determined at random.

item: individual pouches equal to your Intelligence modifier

optionalfeature.name: Ring of Spell Refueling
entries: While wearing this magic ring, the wearer can use an action to recover one of its expended spell slots of 3rd-level or lower.
Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Skyfall Harness
entries: This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between its limbs that slow falls and allow wearers to glide.
When the wearer falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from its fall when calculating falling damage, and it can glide 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot that it falls.

optionalfeature.name: Craft Minor Poison
entries: As an action, you can expend a 1st-level spell slot and use a poisoner's kit to craft one vial of Minor Poison, which retains its potency until the end of your next long rest.

A creature can take the {@action Use an Object} action to expend the vial and apply it to one weapon or a piece of ammunition it is holding. On its next hit, the weapon deals poison damage in place of its normal damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.
The poisoned creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item: one empty vial filled with water

optionalfeature.name: Craft Greater Poison
entries: As an action on your turn, you can expend a 2nd-level spell slot and use a poisoner's kit to craft a vial of Greater Poison, which retains its potency until the end of your next long rest.

A creature can take the {@action Use an Object} action to expend the vial and apply it to one weapon or a piece of ammunition it is holding. On its next hit, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks, have its speed halved, and it cannot take reactions. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
The poisoned creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, these effects end, but on a failure, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage.

item: one empty vial filled with water

optionalfeature.name: Craft Advanced Poison
entries: As an action, you can expend a 3rd-level spell slot and use a poisoner's kit to craft a vial of Advanced Poison, which retains its potency until the end of your next long rest.

A creature can take the {@action Use an Object} action to expend the vial and apply it to one weapon or a piece of ammunition it is holding. On its next hit, it deals an additional {@damage 6d6} acid damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks for 1 hour. If it fails by 5 or more, it is also {@condition blinded} for the duration.
As an action, the poisoned creature can repeat this saving throw. On a success, these effects end, but on a failed save, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} acid damage.

item: one empty vial filled with water

optionalfeature.name: Craft Masterwork Poison
entries: As an action, you can expend a 4th-level spell slot and use your poisoner's kit to craft a vial of Masterwork Poison, which retains its potency until the end of your next long rest.

A creature can take the {@action Use an Object} action to expend the vial and apply it to one weapon or a piece of ammunition it is holding. On its next hit, it deals an additional {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks until a spell of 5th-level or higher is used to neutralize this Masterwork Poison (such as {@spell greater restoration).

If the creature fails by 5 or more, it is {@condition incapacitated}, and it cannot move or speak until it is cured of this poison. A creature may remake the Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn, with the creature no longer being {@condition incapacitated} on a successful save.

item: one empty vial filled with water

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Poison
entries: Over the course of a long rest, you can use a poisoner's kit to examine a vial of poison you touch. At the end of the long rest, you can replace this Infusion with the knowledge of how to create that poison. Once you do so, you can craft one vial of that poison at the end of each long rest. It retains its potency until the end of your next long rest.
You can learn this Infusion multiple times, using it to learn to recreate various poisons that you discover, buy, or craft.

optionalfeature.name: Wall Shield
entries: This magical shield has 4 charges. As an action, the wielder can expend 1 charge and slam the shield into the ground to produce the effect of {@spell wall of stone}. However, it only conjures a number of panels equal to your Intelligence modifier.
When cast in this way, {@spell wall of stone} does not require the wielder's concentration. The wielder can end the spell early by using its action to remove this shield from the ground.

optionalfeature.name: War Gauntlet
entries: You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield, to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this Infusion is active.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: An armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield

optionalfeature.name: Metamorphosis Armor
entries: This magic suit of armor has 4 charges. As an action, the wearer can expend a charge to cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell, targeting only themselves, without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. Expending a charge to cast the spell again ends the effect. This armor regains all charges at dawn.
At 17th level, the wearer can expend up to two charges at one time to reduce or grow their size by two size categories.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Weapon
entries: When the wielder scores a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and the wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Undead are immune to the effects of this Infusion.
At 17th level, the extra necrotic damage becomes {@damage 4d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Boots of Destruction
entries: While wearing these magic boots, the wearer can use an action to stomp the ground and cast {@spell destructive wave} without expending a spell slot. Once they do so, they must finish a short or long rest before they can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Armament
entries: The wielder of this weapon can cast {@spell steel wind strike|xge} without expending a spell slot, so long as they use this magic weapon as the spellcasting focus for the spell.
Once {@spell steel wind strike|xge} is cast in this way, the wielder must finish a short or long rest before it can cast it this way again.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Shot
entries: The wielder of this weapon can cast {@spell swift quiver} without expending a spell slot, so long as they use this magic weapon as the spellcasting focus for the spell.
Once {@spell swift quiver} is cast in this way, the wielder must finish a short or long rest before it can cast it this way again.

optionalfeature.name: Create Minor Elixir
entries: Each time you select this Infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table. To produce an additional minor elixir, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Create Greater Elixir
entries: Each time you select this Infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table. To produce an additional minor elixir, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Create Advanced Elixir
entries: Each time you select this Infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table. To produce an additional minor elixir, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Create Expert Elixir
entries: Each time you select this Infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table. To produce an additional minor elixir, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Create Masterwork Elixir
entries: Each time you select this Infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table. To produce an additional minor elixir, you must expend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher.

hp.special: 1 + two times your artificer level (the Homunculus Servant has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: When your Homunculus Servant is within 120 feet of you, it can deliver any spell you can cast that has a range of touch.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Homunculus Servant makes a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Might of the Master
entries: You can add your PB to any ability check or saving throw that your Homunculus Servant makes.

action.name: Acidic Spittle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 2d4 + PB} acid damage.

action.name: Administer Elixir
entries: The Homunculus can administer an Elixir they are carrying to any creature within 5 feet.

trait.name: Empowered Speed
entries: The Autocycle gains additional speed equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Cargo Hold
entries: The Autocycle can hold cargo up to 200 lb.

trait.name: Expert Handling
entries: If you are mounted on the Autocycle, and not incapacitated, you add your PB to any ability check or saving throw the Autocycle is forced to make.

trait.name: Inanimate
entries: The Autocycle cannot use any of its actions or its movement on its own. A rider must be mounted on it to use its movement speed, and a rider must use its action to use one of the Autocycle's actions.

trait.name: Mechanical Momentum
entries: If the Autocycle moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Jump
entries: If the Autocycle moves at least 30 feet in a straight line, it can clear a distance of up to 60 feet when jumping over a chasm, ravine, or other gap.

trait.name: Prone Deficiency
entries: If the Autocycle falls {@condition prone}, it can't right itself and is {@condition incapacitated} until a creature uses an action on its turn to stand the Autocycle upright.

trait.name: Swerve
entries: When the Autocycle is upright and is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, its rider can use their reaction to grant it advantage on its saving throw.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4 + your Intelligence Modifier} bludgeoning damage.

hp.special: 5 + five times your artificer level (the Steel Defender has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Might of the Master
entries: You can add your PB to any ability check or saving throw that your Steel Defender makes.

trait.name: Humanoid
entries: Your Steel Defender is the size of a Medium humanoid creature. It is proficient with shields, and it has humanoid hands that it can use to perform basic tasks.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The Steel Defender cannot be surprised.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} force damage.

action.name: Repair
entries: The Steel Defender can expend one of its Hit Dice to restore {@damage 1d10 + PB} hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

hp.special: 5 + five times your artificer level (the Steel Defender has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Might of the Master

trait.name: Quadruped
entries: Your Steel Defender resembles a Large beast of your choice. Its speed increases by 10 feet (accounted for in the statblock), and it can be ridden as a mount by you as if it was a trained mount.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The Steel Defender cannot be surprised.
